intro: Dianthus intermedius, commonly known as the common campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its clusters of pink or white flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, branched stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dianthus intermedius is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
